alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 3:55PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. .Heavy rainfall over the Big Piney Basin will cause rivers to rise to around flood stage. Details are included below. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, the Pontoon Training Area at Ft. Wood Floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 3.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 8.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Thursday afternoon at 400 PM CDT.
